__TOC__


Here we have a sampling of bugs to work on for Hug Day.  After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your name in the last column and set the row's background to green by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after "background-color:" and before ";".  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been hugged.

=== 99 bugs with status "New" ===
These are untriaged bug reports regarding Open Office.  You can find more <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/openoffice.org/+bugs?search=Search&field.status=New|in Launchpad]]</nowiki>.

'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Tag the bug with the Open Office component involved - 'ooo-calc', 'ooo-writer', 'ooo-impress', 'ooo-draw' or 'ooo-base' '''and'''
** Ask for more details (possibly the version of Open Office 'dpkg -l openoffice.org' affected or detailed steps to reproduce), change the bug's status to "Incomplete" and subscribe yourself '''or'''
** Recreate the bug (ideally in Hardy), document the test case in the description, and change the bug's status to "Confirmed" 
* If you have reproduced the bug and feel it is worthy of a <nowiki>[[StableReleaseUpdates| Stable Release Update]]</nowiki> please notify an Ubuntu Bug Control member or if there is not one available set the background-color to red.

=== Greasemonkey ===
Do you have greasemonkey installed?  If so you might find <nowiki>[[http://codebrowse.launchpad.net/~brian-murray/ubuntu-gm-scripts/brian-murray/download/brian%40ubuntu.com-20080116041242-nihz12alyvbrnt01/lp_buttontags.user.j-20080108024506-u79sww4f31nuls3f-1/lp_buttontags.user.js|this]]</nowiki> greasemonkey script useful today.  It will create an "Add tag:" row right below any existing tags or above the description.  The pool of tags has been created specifically for today and when you mouseover the tag it will give you a hint as to when to use it.  Nearly all the credit for the script goes to BryceHarrington.
